etymology.description: 是(是) (shì, "to be; yes") + 的(的) (de, "structural particle; possessive particle") = an affirmative response, often used to confirm something.
etymology.interpretation: 是的(是的) (shì de, "yes") is an expression used to affirm or confirm what someone else has said, similar to saying 'yes' or 'that's right' in English. 是(是) (shì, "to be") asserts a state of being or agreement, and 的(的) (de, "particle") is often used to create grammatical structures.

examples.chinese: 他问我要参加吗(他問我要參加嗎)，我回答是的(我回答是的)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèn wǒ yào cānjiā ma, wǒ huídá shì de.
examples.english: He asked me if I wanted to participate, and I answered yes.

examples.chinese: 当被问到是否同意时(當被問到是否同意時)，他只是简单地说是的(他只是簡單地說是的)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng bèi wèn dào shìfǒu tóngyì shí, tā zhǐshì jiǎndān de shuō shì de.
examples.english: When asked if he agreed, he simply said yes.
